DOC.brief_summary: Purpose : The investigator hypothesis , compare nCPAP-applied group , application SLI maneuver follow respiratory support nCPAP immediately afterwards preterm infant high risk RDS would reduce need intubation mechanical ventilation early period ultimately improve respiratory outcome .
DOC.detailed_description: Primary Outcome Measures : Surfactant need , intubation mechanical ventilation need within first 72 hour life SLI ( Sustained Lung Inflation ) maneuver-applied preterm infant non-SLI-applied preterm infant . Secondary Outcome Measures : - Heart rate , fractional inspiratory oxygen , CPAP pressure oxygen saturation within first 72 hour life preterm infant - Total non-invasive , invasive respiratory support time - The presence degree BPD ( Bronchopulmonary dysplasia ) - Premature morbidity PDA ( patent ductus arteriosus ) , IVH ( intraventricular hemorrhage ) , NEC ( necrotizing enterocolitis ) , ROP ( retinopathy prematurity ) - Feeding intolerance , reach birth weight transition full oral feeding time Study Design Randomization Group 1 : Group receive SLI maneuver immediately birth follow nCPAP . Group 2 : Group receive nCPAP birth . Following oral nasal aspirate , SLI 25 cm H2O pressure apply 15 second use t-piece refreshing binasal prongs 5-cm nCPAP H2O pressure apply . Patients observe 5-10 second term cardiorespiratory function follow SLI maneuver . If respiratory failure continue nCPAP ( apnea , gasp ) and/or heart rate > 60 / min < 100 / min , SLI maneuver repeat pressure time period . If heart rate > 60 / min < 100 / min persist second SLI maneuver , resuscitation apply line guideline American Academy Pediatrics . The control group infant receive nCPAP support 5 cm H2O pressure support line guideline American Academy Pediatrics .
DOC.criteria: Preterm infant gestational age 26 week 0 day 29 week 6 day include . 1 . Presence major congenital anomaly , 2 . Patients hydrops fetalis pulmonary hypoplasia 3 . Consent provide refuse
